intro: Angostura fontanesiana, commonly known as the Fontanesiana angostura, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and often covered with a fine layer of hair. Angostura fontanesiana is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and rocky slopes.
